Class EventTypes

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.assign.Types
org.microbean.event.EventTypes
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constable
public final class EventTypes extends Types
A utility for working with event types.
Author:
Laird Nelson

  • Method Details

    • eventTypes

      public final List<? extends TypeMirror> eventTypes(TypeMirror t)
      Returns an immutable List of legal event types that the supplied TypeMirror bears.

      The returned List may be empty.

      Parameters:
      t - a TypeMirror; must not be null
      Returns:
      an immutable List of legal event types that the supplied TypeMirror bears; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if t is null
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and returns determinate values.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • legalEventType

      public static final boolean legalEventType(TypeMirror t)
      Returns true if and only if the supplied TypeMirror is a legal event type.

      Legal event types are, exactly:

      1. Array types whose component types are legal event types
      2. Declared types that contain no wildcard types for every level of containment
      Parameters:
      t - a TypeMirror; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if and only if t is a legal bean type; false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if t is null
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method itself is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but TypeMirror implementations and Domain implementations may not be safe for such use.

    • legalObservedEventType

      public static final boolean legalObservedEventType(TypeMirror t)
      Returns true if and only if the supplied TypeMirror is a legal observed event type.

      A legal observed event type is any Java type that a method parameter may bear.

      Parameters:
      t - a TypeMirror; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if and only if t is a legal observed event type; false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if t is null
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method itself is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but TypeMirror implementations and Domain implementations may not be safe for such use.
